intro: Inhambanella guereensis, commonly known as the Guinean sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Inhambanella guereensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
